net.kuujo.vertigo.cluster

Interface ClusterConfig

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Config<ClusterConfig>, JsonSerializable

    public interface ClusterConfig
extends Config<ClusterConfig>
    Network cluster configuration.

    The cluster configuration is used by Vertigo to determine how the components of a network should be deployed. When a network is deployed in a Vert.x clustered instance, the network can be deployed across the cluster in what is known as the CLUSTER scope. Users can specify in the cluster configuration how a network should be deployed.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String CLUSTER_ADDRESS
      address is the cluster event bus address.
      static String CLUSTER_SCOPE
      scope is the cluster scope.

    • Method Detail

      • setAddress

        ClusterConfig setAddress(String address)
        Sets the cluster address.

        The cluster address is used by Vertigo to deploy components and work with cluster-wide data structures when the network is clustered. If the network is deployed in LOCAL scope then the cluster address does not need to be set up.

        Parameters:
        address - The cluster address.
        Returns:
        The cluster configuration.

      • getAddress

        String getAddress()
        Returns the cluster address.
        Returns:
        The cluster event bus address.

      • setScope

        ClusterConfig setScope(ClusterScope scope)
        Sets the network scope.

        Setting the network's scope to CLUSTER will result in the network's components being deployed across the cluster when Vert.x is a clustered instance. If the cluster scope is being used you must provide an event bus address to the cluster manager. This is the default scope.

        If the scope is set to LOCAL then the network will always be deployed in the local Vert.x instance regardless of the Vert.x cluster state.

        Parameters:
        scope - The network scope.
        Returns:
        The cluster configuration.

      • getScope

        ClusterScope getScope()
        Returns the network scope.
        Returns:
        The network scope. Defaults to CLUSTER
